number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												It's a boring shallow experience. It's just a trek through a boring wasteland with hardly any memorable characters.People praise the graphics for being incredibly well done, which I will agree in some parts it's a beautiful game... However... in some places they were just lazy. Incredibly lazy. Things like vending machines were nothing but flat textures. And this is an item they expect you to interact with. It just brings an insanely bad contrast with really good looking textures and god awful ones that break imersion.The checkpoint, or autosave system is garbage. It's seriously the worst thing ever concieved by a developer, and all it does is bring attention to the terrible menu system. Seriously let me control with both mouse and keyboard. I don't understand why that would be so difficult to do. Let me use esc to exit from in game menu's. Every other game in existence does that already, but apparently it was too difficult for them to do that.The intro was slow and boring, which just really shows how terrible their pacing in this game is.The pacing in this game is just garbage. You are spending half your time walking or driving in a wasteland, or walking to an area to get a mission, only for that mission to have you go back to where you were before. This happened 4 times in the beginning of the game within 5 minutes. It's forced backtracking, and since there is absolutely nothing in between it's just boring.No enemy respawns. Seriously what the hell is up with this? It just makes exploring old areas boring, and basically pointless. As there is no extra loot.Almost every gang was the same. They fought the same (minus a bit of flipping), and used pretty much the same weapons.I haven't beaten the game yet, but when I do I will update the review to cover what I thought of that... if I can even bring myself to finish it.Edit: After about 4 hours into the game, it has picked up a bit. It's still slow and boring for the most part, but there are at least a few entertaining things. Also why does every single character feel like telling me their damn life story every time I talk to them. Since the only way to skip it is to walk away and come back, it's just a huge annoyance.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2016
												This game was met with mixed reviews on release, while I can accept some of the criticisms about this title I think it has been unjustly referred to as a mediocre game and I feel that if you are an FPS fan then this really is 100% worth playing.This is an FPS game set in a post-apocalyptic world, it has limited looting, crafting and RPG elements but it is at it's heart a shooter and a vehicle combat game. I personally would recommend playing this game on a pad, as it's not a competitive FPS title. The game was definitely designed with a pad in mind and the interface is much easier to use (switching quick use items for example). Not to mention driving the vehicles!Graphically I think the game excels, the landscapes are superb as is the detail and you can tell a lot of thought has gone into the level design. The characters are well done, although many of the unimportant NPC's have similar features. The negatives I can say about the graphics though is some texture 'pop in' from time to time. On the whole this is not a problem and doesn't detract, the one point at which I would say it was noticeable to the point of distracting was in the level 'dead city'.The sound on the whole is well done, the weapon and engine noises are very good. The voice acting on the whole is also good although they have clearly used the same actor for multiple NPC's. What I would say though is it is quite annoying that you yourself do not speak, it ruins the immersion a little bit as this game is really supposed to a bit of an RPG lite. Also the most annoying sound quirk is when driving in game, quite often a change of speed or action appears to cause the engine sound to cut out. This is very poor and it did annoy me quite a bit.The gameplay was enjoyable, it is a classic ID shooter really. Although it has open world sections most of the fighting is really done in well-designed levels and set pieces. The enemy character movements are top notch and they jump and dodge your fire, heading for cover and shooting from behind obstacles. Although within the gameplay is my biggest gripe about this game, when enemy character enters an animation when hit in a certain place. i.e. they fall to the ground injured. You can quite often rain a hail of bullets into them and they somehow seem to resist significantly more damage than they would ordinarily while in this state. This really did get on my nerves and was one of the reasons when I first starting playing this I was a little put off.If you can look past this games few flaws and appreciate the love that appears to have been poured into creating this game then there is a solid 30-40 hours of very enjoyable gameplay and some really fantastic graphics. Even by today’s standards. Also the achievements are quite straight forward and rewarding to play towards giving the game a bit of extra replayability. I would highly recommend this game to any FPS fan, it really is a must play.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												I love sci-fi, and the cyberpunk look of this game is outstanding!  For me, this is such a great game I have to place it a solid third behind the Mass Effect series and the first two Bioshock games.  Killer graphics, perfect game play, great music, interesting characters and acting, decent story, effective and varied weapons, and good overall play time - pretty near a perfect combo, for me.  Coming back to this game after a few years I'm kind of shocked at how well the graphics in this game have held up!  Add some exciting and intelligent racing (if you want), and anytime saving and health regen, and you have one of the all-time greats!  The ending is a little lackluster, but I can't judge a 30+ hour game experience on a less than perfect ending.  Highly recommended!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Rage puts you in a wasteland, full of twisted minds, and mutations. The game is not emotional, it does not have the greatest writing, and it is pretty much a Racing/Slaughterfest hybrid. And I love it. The game is linear, yet not so linear that you feel bored. It does have sidequests, and collectibles, that you can pick up along the way. This makes for a great game for those, who seeks the 100% Completion.There is lots of killing, and explosions, infact, they could most likely ship it as a Micheal Bay movie, however, it doesn't get tiresome. However, there is some flaws with Rage, and first and formost, the textures. The textures, which look awful, and many have considered this a core issue of the game. I also dislike the gambling part of the game, because, you rarely lose money, and more often than not, the money you get from simply gambling for ten minutes, can often throw you far ahead in weapon and veichle upgrades, that the game gets easy.I highly recommend this game, if you want to have a fun singleplayer game, however, you shouldn't expect any masterpiece. 7.8/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												Ok, this is a pretty fun game, but I probably wouldn't have bought it if it wasn't in a Steam Sale. It's pretty reminiscent of Borderlands; hell, even one of the towns looks like it was lifted right from Pandora. I had fun playing it but, it was really lacking in two things: a story, and a freaking resolution.The whole time I was playing I kept thinking to myself "okay, I'm going to find out more about why I'm randomly just teaming up with people hundreds of years in the future" and "I'm totally going to meet that crazy Ark survivor everyone's talking about and duke it out!" WRONG.You have no context. You're literally a robot following orders for no reason. Why would you have any incentive to do anything? YOU DON'T. The player character has no name, no place to call home, and no friends. He has zero incentive to help anybody, and no one even bothers to ask what he wants to do, if he's confused, or even give him a moment to realize he's IN THE FUTURE. And as for the no resolution? Well, there's no conclusion to the story. IT JUST ENDS. Right when you think you're at the halfway point, BAM!!! Game's over!!!! I don't even care if there's DLC to continue the story, that's horrible game design right there.All in all if you want to shoot people in the face with neat guns and pay a crap tonne of money to keep well stocked, or if you just didn't get enough Borderlands, play RAGE. >: (

I would preface this with a proper spoiler alert, but you can't spoil something that didn't even happen. The game doesn't have a proper ending. You fight a few waves of weak enemies and then you're treated to a five second cutscene. That's it. Nothing else happens. You don't have a showdown with the ultimately faceless antagonist. You don't really see the fruits of your labour. The game. just. ends. I felt cheated.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												I'm writing this review for one reason only: the bad rap that some have given this game is wholly undeserved. If you like fast action shooters (with a fair amount of pulse pounding racing - something I struggled with at times), then you don't want to miss this action shooter. It's got great guns and weapons, which actually can be modified to increase their power. The simple pistol you start out with can be turned into one nasty killing weapon with the right parts and money. You have all types of guns (the modded shotgun is awesome), and even a deadly crossbow. Money is hard to come by, but it is available. Sell as much as you can to the traders to use on upgrades. Sure, the plot is a bit thin, this isn't Skyrim or a plot-centric game, although it does have a plot. The enemies are at times relentless, so never stand still. Keep moving, shooting, use cover when you can. the Sniper rifle is awesome. My only complaints are the two of the BOSS fights are ridiculously hard (might need to cheat on one of them, but that's possible, google it). Single player only for me, but tons of enjoyment, never a dull moment. The car racing is very hard using just a keyboard and mouse, I have the feeling this was a console port that used controllers  but if you persist and really push the pedal to the metal, eventually you can win enough to pimp your ride to badass fighting machine. I loved this game for just one reason - it's just freaking FUN, something so many games today seem to forget. It should be fun. Fun, fun, fun and gets the blood pumping. I hate that I have to delete it (there is still more to do, but I've completed most of the game and I need the disk space for Wasteland 2! :)9.5/10 for fun. (what better reason than to play a game?)8/10 graphics6/10 racing9/10 action and excitment. 9/10 for weapons and nice rpg-like elements like upgrading weaponsOverall, I cannot give this less than 8.5/10. Get the scorchers DLC and it's 9/10. This game is so underrated and under appreciated it sucks, but if you like what you read above, get this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2012
												Rage is an excellent first person shooter. The graphics are great - especially on my pc spec - they look well lush. The wasteland scenery is immersive; the game-play is great, with a good interesting story. This game IMO has many fun elements to keep one playing it: The shooting mechanics in this game are superb, and very well balanced IMO, all the guns look and sound great, and killing with the special ammo adds a whole new creative dynamic to game-play. I was always being surprised by the many ways I could use them to kill enemies in certain situations,  The crafting engineering system is good to use, it's well balanced and not too deep when creating special items. The vehicles are fast and fun to drive while travelling the huge open wastelands, much needed when getting around from place to place. I really enjoyed the wide open atmospheric wastelands; they were always encouraging me to explore new areas of interest.In a nutshell: I thoroughly enjoyed playing this game!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												Its been a long time coming but today i finally finished this bloody game.I bought it a few weeks after launch, but it hasn't taken me this long to beat it because its difficult or long, its just.. a frustratingly beautiful game.I think i uninstalled / installed this game 4 or 5 times. Its 20 bloody gigs and there were times when i needed the space and felt the game just wasn't worth playing any more. Being a huge fan of Doom and most of i.d's games, i forced myself to give it another crack.I'll say it again. This game is frustrating. Not due to difficulty, but because of how often you will ask "what were they thinking?!".There is just far too much back tracking across the landscape for running pathetic errands. I was turned off immediately by how quickly your pulled into a conflict rather than a slow build up. Within 5 minites of the first guy saving your life after you step out of the life pod, he's asking you to go to a bandit camp and wipe them all out. Sorry, but the player JUST woke up from some kind of hyper sleep pod thing 5 minutes ago and 100 years has passed. He should be walked through the game and given some warm up missions and shown what kind of word he has woken up into.A big problem that will hit PC games early, is how much this game feels like its on rails. Lets not beat around the bush. This is a console game, designed for boys with game pads. You don't have any freedom to go where you want. See a hand rail thats only knee high and want to jump over? Nope. Invisible wall. Want to jump onto that rock? Nope, invisible wall. See all that cool environment around you that you want to explore every inch of to find hidden stuff? Nope, its all blocked off by invisible walls.To be fair, this is probably i.d's finest work. Its the best attempt at a story yet and the art is simply amazing. The Jackel Canyon level has got to be one of the most visually stunning game environments i've ever seen. The megatexture tech making every rock wall of this level look unique and truly beautiful. The final level, for all its failures, is still an incredibly detailed level that few games can compete with for detail. Including Crysis 3. That is until you get up close and everything looks as if its made from poor quality printed photos on paper. Its grainy and blurry and possibly some of the most heartbreakingly awful compression thats ever happened to a games textures. Those poor artists!Surely they must've all played the game and thought to themselves "wow, all our lovel art looks terrible now, we should really release a different version for the PC on Bluray with uncompressed textures", right? No. This is where the problem of a developer being at the mercy of a publisher rears its ugly head. The publisher pushes them to release on all platforms at once to maximize sales and keep the consumers happy. The days of releasing a top quality ground breaking game for PC, then scaling it back for console gamers is over (ahem crytek..). Plus, no one wants to deal with complaints from hoardes of twelve year olds that the PC version looks amzing, yet on their console it looks like its viewed from the eyes of an 18 year old fox terrier with glaucoma.If you have not yet played Borderlands, wait till you've played Rage. Otherwise you'll spend way too much time cringing at just how "on rails" this game is. Play Borderlands afterwards, and see what potential Rage had.The combat is ace and the art and animations are first class, but the scale is let down by limited freedom to explore and a weak vehicle element.Sure its an enjoyable shooter and i'll recommend it simply for the combat, but only if you pick it up from a bargain bin for $5.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Behold, fetch quest, the game.Might change my mind after i play it more.Edit: Nope. Opinion not changed at all.Its still fetch quest and "Go here, talk to ths guy. Accept his quest. Do it. Go back to the quest giver, get reward, go to other guy."You're basically everyones post apocolyptic errand boy. The funniest part is that you just woke up from cryo sleep or something not an hour ago and people are already making you drive around like the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mailman. One guy STILL owes me an armor suit that he said he'd give me, but never did, nor did he tell me where to find it.There is one thing i will praise and one thing only. I like how the friendly NPC's seem bizarrely cheery. Its almost surreal given the environment. With mutants (That dissolve on death for some reason) and angry psychopaths everywhere. Its like they're all on ecstasy.Ok another thing, the animation is spectacular. NPC movement is fluid and natural.Now onto the rest.The gunplay is average and thats whats wrong with it. Theres nothng particularly fun about it, its just pointing metal things at soft things and pushing a button until the soft thing stops moving. This is the basic formula of most FPS games and theres nothing wrong with it. But somehow in this game its just monotonous and not entertaining in any way.Ok i have this one somewhat odd gripe, the ragdolls. They're abysmal. They make the skyrim ragdolls look like they have actual human joints instead of being broken animatronic dolls. They're so stiff its just not fun to watch them fly around. It also gives them this bizarre twitch when they transition from fluid animation to unreasonably stiff physics. Which is a shame because the death animations are spectacular. They also twitch oddly when you loot them. And sometimes get  partially stuck in the ground.The graphics, They're ok. Average. They don't stand out as being good or bad, they're just ok. Skyboxes are awesome, but since the maps are basically linear hallways with little room to explore, the graphics engine never gets a chance to shine.The maps. As i said above, i haven't played much. I also said that the maps are basically glorified straight lines. And linearity is ok if the gameplay is fun and the story is interesting. But since RAGE has neither of that. Its just really dull. Again, the engine seems perfect for rendering massive expansive worlds. But i have yet to see even a medium field in this game.The story. All i've really got is that a big rock hit the earth and almost everything died. Thats about it. Because now all i'm doing is running between two clans of hicks fetching things for them so they can continue to stand around doing nothing.Sound. Nothing special. The voice actors atleast sound like they're into it. But haven't really noticed anything unique.In short. This is what you get if you stick fallout and borderlands in a blender and set it to "Boring".3/10.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2016
												Not really a bad game, but coming from ID, it kind of disappointed me. Yes, I am aware that its also Bethesda now, but that might just be the problem. The mechanics are fair, the enemies are pretty interesting, and the textures are nice, along with the weapons in my opinion. However, the weapons are more typical of the more common first person shooter. Having devastating ammo types was a good move, but I believe that the weapons in general should be lootable from various enemies. The other issue is that this is a pretty bad port for a beloved studio such as ID. All in all, it's worth the current price, but don't expect to much out of this game. I have noticed that people have bashed this game for ripping off borderlands. That is actually false, as this game was in development before borderlands, even if it came out last. You can thank 2k for their brilliant rip-off known as borderlands. This game does borrow a lot from fallout, which is only excusable if you count the fact that both this game and fallout 3 through 4 were made by Bethesda.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Having a blast with this game, finally getting around to it in late 2015.Update: Finished the game finally.  I'm going to keep things generic to avoid spoilers.It's a light shooter with great atmosphere and (mostly optional) racing elements.The first (larger) half of the game is in an awesome Mad Max desert kind of world.The game then moves to a different (maybe a bit shorter) area and gets more cyber-punk blade-runner.This game alows going between the two areas but does have "can't go back for it" elements within specific dungeons.  Mostly finding cards for the minigame and hidden areas (which usually require a couple lock grinders handy at all times), but occasionally a weapon-based achievement is much easier at a very specific point in a dungeon.The ending is a let-down.  The closest thing to a spoiler is that...... there's no boss fight.The multiplayer community is non-existent.  Let me know if you get this game and want to play it, I'd love to get some multiplayer achievements!Verdict: $10, play it casually like a movie.  Good for "between" epic games when you need a break.Get the DLC if you liked the first area of the game.  It's even lighter with a very stereotypical "babe" added.  It adds itself automatically as a quest you can complete during the original game (actually the DLC lets you continue after the ending as well).  Just go back to the original Wasteland area and it will have a quest marker.  It does have a boss fight but is really more of the same.  If you're looking for story or depth forget it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Its a shame rage wasn't more popular, I REALLY enjoyed playing it through, even though it has its problems, I recommend anyone do the same, there is a good game here waiting to be played.Good things :   -Clearly a good game engine		-Game feels nice and a pleasure to play		-The game design and therefore the end product seems much better than it initially seems		-You are not drowned in possibilities of this open world which seems like your going back and forth for no                     reason...  Bad things :  -Can feel quite Linear at times	             -Difficulty because of gamedesign is Abysmal  - this is not a diffcult or chllenging gmae in any form! RAGE is very shallow on the exteria, but if you give it the time, it does introduce a very wide variety of fairly intersting, (though most are not ground breaking) dynamics and makes them work quite well(which is what is so good), it is not the sort of game that strikes you as being elegant that much at all. But trust me it has has plenty of decent stuff to keep you busy and not keep you running around for hours doing nothing and getting bored.  Combat is good enough, shooting  and conquering is nice on Rage, in the usual ID way (Doom, Quake etc), but from the start the variation of weapons feels like it could be better(irronically in the ID way :P), as most are similar to any other game, though, I would suggest that all players endure this , until you get the full load of weapons and multiple ammo types which much more liberty with tactics and stratgy in combat; even with your seemingly standard load-out.Whats more becuase there is a simple crafting system , it extends the weapons further and even accessories like sentry bots, whcih is pretty cool.Its clear it trys to be Borderlands and emulates the environment, but the story is actually better than Borderlands and so is the game(or at least I prefer this).  In saying that I never really liked borderlands that much... I would play this over BL any day... The story was good, and infact the usual 'you are a special kind of soldier type' in ID games is apparent on this game too, though the different kind of Post-Apocalypse scenario is quite intersting when you think about it. The main forte of the gmae is an impressive engine via ID, which makes shooting, racing and exploring a really nice experience.  It looks nice, it feels nice in all aspects.Because of this engine, the racing/driving  doesn't look shoddy(like Borderlands) and feels ok.  There was an issue at the start of the game with the handbreak that is not balanced with the first vehicles, but trust me when I say that it improves when you get your 3rd vehicle(you may have to upgrade it).  You can adapt to using the hand break in some capacity on the 2nd vehicle though...  Racing, though I am not really fussed about racing games, is not too bad, I enjoyed it.  There is plenty of variation in racing matches, from standard racing matches to the sequential  'Domination' matches(the first to get to a check point get points, the first to 40 points wins(Blowing others up gives you points too...) which does throw the strategy to race on its head(which I think is quite good).The Music is fine, parts of it sounds un-natural to me, and some of the style of both the composer and the music suck, *To me*.  But in saying that, its not too bad and the music is good when you are playing through the game, and can actually be quite good in parts.I will add the worst thing about this game was the difficulty.  This game is SSOOoo easy!  If you are bad at FPS: PLAY RAGE!  You have at least 2 lives and you heal constantly, so unless you keep passing out on the keyboard, you will be fine!  I played this on Hard and found it not much of a challenge at all and perhaps after some days that was nice, but I want a challenge from any game I play and Believe me , RAGE isn't challeging in the slightest!  I am keen to play through in nightmare mode , just to see if they actually have ANY challenging difficulty modes at all!Word of advice:If you are buying this on steam, Dont play on 64bit mode unless you have to:i.e. this mode:		* Rage 64bit(not supported) for mods*When you start up the game.  If you want to stick in the hours to finish the campaign and you want to play to get achievements, dont play on 64bit mode, also 64 bit mode takes a LONG time to load an area, and its not like 2x the time, but more like 50x.. literally my computer takes 5minutes just to load town or the wasteland from any loacation... In standard 32 bit mode, it takes about 10 seconds... So avoid 64bit mode unlesss you really want to use it!  I got half way through the game before realising achievements were not logged and had to start again on the 32bit mode ( you cant access 64bit data in 32 bit game!) .

												WINGSTICKS! buy right away, because these things are more deadly that bullets in this game. i really enjoyed my time with RAGE. you'll see the most beautiful sky dome in anygame.. then look at the most ugly plant in any game ever. for the most part this game looks amazing and plays well. The Scorchers DLC is worth trying out. adds a little extra to the game which in itself is rather short. and to quote my lovely & adoreable Steam friend "did the ending make you RAAAGE?!?" i know they're very funny lol, but no. i enjoyed the experience. the story was alright.caveat emptor (buyer beware): this game does not play nice with anything other than Nvidia cards (cards with CUDA). also, look to buy the retail copy (physical media) of the game, the special Anarchy Edition. it comes with some unique DLC which you can’t purchase on Steam.turn on smart v-sync & GPU transcode in the options menu in gamecreate a cache folder in this location name/AppData/Local (Windows start menu, "%temp%" click entre and work backwards)  “id software” go into it and create a second folder called “rage” (all in lower case) and once you start the game again it’ll create cache files to reduce stutter and texture pop.in the"base" folder where your copy of RAGE is installed. copy the .cfg file and rename it to rageconfig.cfg if you don’t already have one. open with notepad and delete all the text. write “+cvaradd g_fov 10” which adds +10 to the base field of view. *optional lines to add*com_videoRam 2048fc_maxcachememoryMB 2048vt_useCudaTranscode 0vt_maxPPF 128vt_pageimagesizeuniquediffuseonly2 8192vt_pageimagesizeuniquediffuseonly 8192vt_pageimagesizeunique 8192vt_pageimagesizevmtr 8192vt_restartvt_maxaniso 4image_anisotropy 4

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 29, 2012
												ID Software at it's finest!This game runs on the polished and refined ID Tech 5 engine that was brilliantly engineered by John Carmak. The game uses a beautiful new texture rendering system that gives the game a beautiful look to it that is unmatched by most games. Gameplay wise, the game has such a wide variety of things to do! It's a perfect FPS game with unbelievably incredible AI, interacting with the environment making sure that each battle is something new as well as an undefined RPG system to accompany the game. Sure, it's pretty linear compared to other RPG titles such as Fallout and S.T.A.L.K.E.R, but the game still offers an extremely large amount of exploration and side quests to complete. The game is also followed up with a nice racing addition with intense races and awesome vehicle combat. RAGE is definitely one of the best shooters I've played this year and should be checked out by anyone who appreciates the FPS genre with a little twist to it.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2016
												Not very good, not very fun. Small open world with nothing to do and no reason to spend any time there. Levels are reused multiple times, and there are only a handful of them and they are the definition of linear. 70% of combat is just fighting off waves of enemies while locked in small areas, the other 30% is a corridor shooter with bullet sponge enemies. Invisible walls EVERYWHERE. It runs like garbage for what it is. Tons of audio glitches. Some textures, specifically environmental ones, look beautiful from far away, but terrible once you get close. The game as a whole seems poorly thought out and the story and missions rushed and incomplete.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Behold, fetch quest, the game.Might change my mind after i play it more.Edit: Nope. Opinion not changed at all.Its still fetch quest and "Go here, talk to ths guy. Accept his quest. Do it. Go back to the quest giver, get reward, go to other guy."You're basically everyones post apocolyptic errand boy. The funniest part is that you just woke up from cryo sleep or something not an hour ago and people are already making you drive around like the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mailman. One guy STILL owes me an armor suit that he said he'd give me, but never did, nor did he tell me where to find it.There is one thing i will praise and one thing only. I like how the friendly NPC's seem bizarrely cheery. Its almost surreal given the environment. With mutants (That dissolve on death for some reason) and angry psychopaths everywhere. Its like they're all on ecstasy.Ok another thing, the animation is spectacular. NPC movement is fluid and natural.Now onto the rest.The gunplay is average and thats whats wrong with it. Theres nothng particularly fun about it, its just pointing metal things at soft things and pushing a button until the soft thing stops moving. This is the basic formula of most FPS games and theres nothing wrong with it. But somehow in this game its just monotonous and not entertaining in any way.Ok i have this one somewhat odd gripe, the ragdolls. They're abysmal. They make the skyrim ragdolls look like they have actual human joints instead of being broken animatronic dolls. They're so stiff its just not fun to watch them fly around. It also gives them this bizarre twitch when they transition from fluid animation to unreasonably stiff physics. Which is a shame because the death animations are spectacular. They also twitch oddly when you loot them. And sometimes get  partially stuck in the ground.The graphics, They're ok. Average. They don't stand out as being good or bad, they're just ok. Skyboxes are awesome, but since the maps are basically linear hallways with little room to explore, the graphics engine never gets a chance to shine.The maps. As i said above, i haven't played much. I also said that the maps are basically glorified straight lines. And linearity is ok if the gameplay is fun and the story is interesting. But since RAGE has neither of that. Its just really dull. Again, the engine seems perfect for rendering massive expansive worlds. But i have yet to see even a medium field in this game.The story. All i've really got is that a big rock hit the earth and almost everything died. Thats about it. Because now all i'm doing is running between two clans of hicks fetching things for them so they can continue to stand around doing nothing.Sound. Nothing special. The voice actors atleast sound like they're into it. But haven't really noticed anything unique.In short. This is what you get if you stick fallout and borderlands in a blender and set it to "Boring".3/10.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												Overall, Rage is an OK game.  It tries to be part Mad Max, part Fallout, and part Doom but never seems to do much else that is original (other than the boomerang, which was neat).  You get to drive and do vehicular combat, shoot lots of things, buy and upgrade equipment, and go on many side missions.  Voice acting and sound are done very well.The graphics, while very unique, look great from afar but getting up close to anything looks crappy.  There is absolutely minimal interactivity with the environments so it's  very much focused on getting to the goal and not doing much else.  The story itself is mildly engaging, but really finishes with a blah ending.I can't say I loved it, but I never hated it either - I just wished it could have been something more.  It had all the potential to be. I've played it a few times now, so I guess I'll recommend it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2015
												What could have been? RAGE had so much promise but in the end fell short. The story is pretty ordinary and the ending feels like it was created only to have a sequel come out immidiately afterwards as it doesn't really explain anything. Not much is explained throughout really. So if your looking for a FPS with a decent storyline, look elsewhere. What you will find here though is a solid FPS. The combat is great if you enjoy old school FPS action where waves of enemies come at you in arenas and corridors and you blow their heads off with a decently varied arsenal (special mention to the wingsticks which are kick-@ss). And let's be honest, who doesn't enjoy blowing mutants away in a Mad Max-esque wasteland. Come to think of it they could have just called this Mad Max. The setting and art style are very familiar in that respect. As is the driving where you'll be kitting out various vehicles with armour and weapons to take on bandit vechicles in the wasteland. The driving generally is reasonably forgettable and only serves to get to the next destination to blow away more bandit/mutant/authority scum.  There's a bunch of mini-games thrown in that are all pretty crap except for the card game. I actually thought that was cool. The graphics deserve a mention as they still hold up 4 years later and it still looks beautiful. Largely the graphical issues that plauged the PC port when it first came out have gone. Some of the scenery is amazing and the characters models are great and well animated. If you like good old school shooting then do yourself a favour and go bury a wingstick in a bandit's head.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2015
												I wasn't going to get this game, but after some careful thought and watching many trailers and game play videos, I decided to go out and give it a shot. I do not regret it one bit. This game is amazing. The graphics, sound, setting, ai, animations, mechanics, everything looks, and feels so good. Any fan of post-apocalyptic games needs to give this game a try. Any fan of shooters will not be disappointed, the enemies are always behaving in different ways, allowing you to utilise your entire arsenal in many different ways. The driving is a welcome addition and I found it a very enjoyable way to get to your quests. I've heard a lot of bad things (from critics and gamers alike), mainly in regards to story, but with a solid set of mechanics and awesome location and graphics, a less than awesome story is fine with me (I've only played 3 hours, so I am unable to give my own comments on the story). This game is definitely worth the money and you will not regret your purchase!

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												Apparently the game was plagued by buggy video drivers and issues when it came out and so there's still a lot of dismissal of it online, but when I got this game it ran perfectly and looked great. Texture quality could be better when you get right up against things, but from normal viewing distances it looks fine for when it came out. The gameplay is pretty bog-standard FPS with minimal RPG elements, but FPS is iD's bread and butter so it very well done for what it is.If you're going into it looking for something like Fallout or Borderlands, you're going to be very unsatisfied - the only commonalities are the general setting concept. While the visuals may not be the best in the world but the atmosphere itself still really stood out and I did at times wish it was a deeper or more open game set in that world.Campaign was about 18 hours for me which is pretty good for an FPS in my book - certainly more than any of the Quake single-player campaigns. There is a vehicular DM mode and short coop campaign mode, but I didn't try any of the multiplayer. I wish the main campaign supported coop as I would have loved to play through it with a friend.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												First the good:  Rage looks great.   The graphics, animations, character designs, etc, are all fantastic.  It also plays great.  The gameplay isn't anytihng really new, with the standard fps weapon selection and enemy types.   However, good enemy AI combined with their unique tendency to bob and weave and climb around levels, combined with very solid game mechanics, keeps things fun enough.   Vehicular combat is also enjoyable; rally racing itself seems like it could be a fun PVP standalone, and I'd love to have a local multiplayer version.  Now for the bad:  Nothing in Rage feels like it matters.  While the world and the characters in it look and sound great, none of them do anything or have any particular characteristics to make you care about them one way or the other.  They are merely window dressing.  The storyline itself is a bare bones mash up of Half Life 2 and Fallout, with bland generic factions like the Resistance and the Authority.  There is no main antagonist.   Missions are repetitive, with side quests basically just sending you back to zones you've already cleared in story missions.   It's also far too easy to actually be engaging, and you'll never really experience any of the tension that the games great looking enemies could have inspired.    Also, the game was also clearly designed and optimized for console, and some of the UI elements are just awful on PC (for example, only being able to assign 4 useable items to quickslot keys, rather than just allowing the player to assign them to whatever keys they like).  The game doesn't intelligently determine when you're using a keyboard/mouse or a controller, so controller propmts will stay on the screen even when using a keyboard until you disable the controller in settings (something I don't like doing, because generally I  use a controller for the driving portions of the game, and a keyboard/mouse for shooting).  There are also notiiceable performance issues, with framerates occasionaly plummetting for no good reason, and textures bouncing back and forth between high and low quality versions (this is on a gtx 960, which should be more than adequate to run this game at full settings).   I'm kind of on the fence about whether to recommend this game or not; really I'd give it about a 60-70 at most, and there are certainly better games out there to play.    Since Steams system requires giving it either a yay or nay, I'll recommend it with a couple of strong caveats: If you're looking for an engaging story, avoid it.  If you want a game that's perfectly optimized for PC, avoid it.   If you are strictly looking for a pretty looking, decent FPS, by all means give it a shot.

												WINGSTICKS! buy right away, because these things are more deadly that bullets in this game. i really enjoyed my time with RAGE. you'll see the most beautiful sky dome in anygame.. then look at the most ugly plant in any game ever. for the most part this game looks amazing and plays well. The Scorchers DLC is worth trying out. adds a little extra to the game which in itself is rather short. and to quote my lovely & adoreable Steam friend "did the ending make you RAAAGE?!?" i know they're very funny lol, but no. i enjoyed the experience. the story was alright.caveat emptor (buyer beware): this game does not play nice with anything other than Nvidia cards (cards with CUDA). also, look to buy the retail copy (physical media) of the game, the special Anarchy Edition. it comes with some unique DLC which you can’t purchase on Steam.turn on smart v-sync & GPU transcode in the options menu in gamecreate a cache folder in this location name/AppData/Local (Windows start menu, "%temp%" click entre and work backwards)  “id software” go into it and create a second folder called “rage” (all in lower case) and once you start the game again it’ll create cache files to reduce stutter and texture pop.in the"base" folder where your copy of RAGE is installed. copy the .cfg file and rename it to rageconfig.cfg if you don’t already have one. open with notepad and delete all the text. write “+cvaradd g_fov 10” which adds +10 to the base field of view. *optional lines to add*com_videoRam 2048fc_maxcachememoryMB 2048vt_useCudaTranscode 0vt_maxPPF 128vt_pageimagesizeuniquediffuseonly2 8192vt_pageimagesizeuniquediffuseonly 8192vt_pageimagesizeunique 8192vt_pageimagesizevmtr 8192vt_restartvt_maxaniso 4image_anisotropy 4

												Not very good, not very fun. Small open world with nothing to do and no reason to spend any time there. Levels are reused multiple times, and there are only a handful of them and they are the definition of linear. 70% of combat is just fighting off waves of enemies while locked in small areas, the other 30% is a corridor shooter with bullet sponge enemies. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												Its been a long time coming but today i finally finished this bloody game.I bought it a few weeks after launch, but it hasn't taken me this long to beat it because its difficult or long, its just.. a frustratingly beautiful game.I think i uninstalled / installed this game 4 or 5 times. Its 20 bloody gigs and there were times when i needed the space and felt the game just wasn't worth playing any more. Being a huge fan of Doom and most of i.d's games, i forced myself to give it another crack.I'll say it again. This game is frustrating. Not due to difficulty, but because of how often you will ask "what were they thinking?!".There is just far too much back tracking across the landscape for running pathetic errands. I was turned off immediately by how quickly your pulled into a conflict rather than a slow build up. Within 5 minites of the first guy saving your life after you step out of the life pod, he's asking you to go to a bandit camp and wipe them all out. Sorry, but the player JUST woke up from some kind of hyper sleep pod thing 5 minutes ago and 100 years has passed. He should be walked through the game and given some warm up missions and shown what kind of word he has woken up into.A big problem that will hit PC games early, is how much this game feels like its on rails. Lets not beat around the bush. This is a console game, designed for boys with game pads. You don't have any freedom to go where you want. See a hand rail thats only knee high and want to jump over? Nope. Invisible wall. Want to jump onto that rock? Nope, invisible wall. See all that cool environment around you that you want to explore every inch of to find hidden stuff? Nope, its all blocked off by invisible walls.To be fair, this is probably i.d's finest work. Its the best attempt at a story yet and the art is simply amazing. The Jackel Canyon level has got to be one of the most visually stunning game environments i've ever seen. The megatexture tech making every rock wall of this level look unique and truly beautiful. The final level, for all its failures, is still an incredibly detailed level that few games can compete with for detail. Including Crysis 3. That is until you get up close and everything looks as if its made from poor quality printed photos on paper. Its grainy and blurry and possibly some of the most heartbreakingly awful compression thats ever happened to a games textures. Those poor artists!Surely they must've all played the game and thought to themselves "wow, all our lovel art looks terrible now, we should really release a different version for the PC on Bluray with uncompressed textures", right? No. This is where the problem of a developer being at the mercy of a publisher rears its ugly head. The publisher pushes them to release on all platforms at once to maximize sales and keep the consumers happy. The days of releasing a top quality ground breaking game for PC, then scaling it back for console gamers is over (ahem crytek..). Plus, no one wants to deal with complaints from hoardes of twelve year olds that the PC version looks amzing, yet on their console it looks like its viewed from the eyes of an 18 year old fox terrier with glaucoma.If you have not yet played Borderlands, wait till you've played Rage. Otherwise you'll spend way too much time cringing at just how "on rails" this game is. Play Borderlands afterwards, and see what potential Rage had.The combat is ace and the art and animations are first class, but the scale is let down by limited freedom to explore and a weak vehicle element.Sure its an enjoyable shooter and i'll recommend it simply for the combat, but only if you pick it up from a bargain bin for $5.

												Not really a bad game, but coming from ID, it kind of disappointed me. Yes, I am aware that its also Bethesda now, but that might just be the problem. The mechanics are fair, the enemies are pretty interesting, and the textures are nice, along with the weapons in my opinion. However, the weapons are more typical of the more common first person shooter. Having devastating ammo types was a good move, but I believe that the weapons in general should be lootable from various enemies. The other issue is that this is a pretty bad port for a beloved studio such as ID. All in all, it's worth the current price, but don't expect to much out of this game. I have noticed that people have bashed this game for ripping off borderlands. That is actually false, as this game was in development before borderlands, even if it came out last. You can thank 2k for their brilliant rip-off known as borderlands. This game does borrow a lot from fallout, which is only excusable if you count the fact that both this game and fallout 3 through 4 were made by Bethesda.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												RAGE is a First-Person Open World Shooter with Survival Horror elements and inspiration from Mad Max. The graphics look very well polished, for a wasteland, and the gameplay is well done. The storyline isn't anything good, to be honest, the worst ending of gaming. Back to Gameplay, the combat is fun, same to Coop. So here we go for Pros and Cons!Pros:+Completly Gorgeous Looking Sky+Great Gameplay+Fun Coop Mode+Mad Max Inspiration+Creepy at points+Weapon Variety and Idle Animations+Easter Eggs+Well Used Cars (like Mad Max!)Cons:-Bad Storyline-Slightly Small Open World-Texture Pop-Ups and Rendering Delay-Graphics are not SO good-Short-Optimization Issues-A.I isn't very good-Shooting is inferior than 1993's DOOMOverall, RAGE is a good game but it isn't great. It's fun and a lot more, but for a long time of development, 1 TB of size when compressed, and the wasted potential, RAGE slightly falls short, but for me, RAGE is a game definately worth playing.7.9/10 ~Great Mad Max Inspiration.

												It was pretty good but I feel like there should have been a lot more to the game after the long dev time. I don't really know what all the jazz was about the engine, certainly wasn't an ugly game but not what I expected. I found that the only weapons I used were the sniper, shotty and rocket launcher (for the bigger guys), never used one turret or health pack, maybe 2 or three bots, I never found any reason or incentive to be creative with the ammo types (just stuck with the standard) or craftable items. I did enjoy the game but I'm glad I didn't pay 60 dollars for it. Racing/driving sections were meh and the game was overall VERY easy even on the hardest mode. Oh yeah the ending was balls. I guess I expected more from id but it seems all the old school devs are not putting any heart into their games anymore (with the exception of a couple). Probably just me getting old and cranky.

												The fact that it's an iD game creates certain expectations and it may not live up to that hype. But if you look beyond that, then there's a fun game with really good graphics and atmosphere. The firefights may not be all that challenging a lot of the times but the game brings a lot of diversity with driving sections and minigames (some of which are cool, others quite boring). While the story is mostly fluff, the wonderfully designed environments it takes you through are easily worth the effort.The PC version works fine (download the rageconfig file to fix the texture memory usage!) but all the UI hints are still for an XBOX controller and it's never clear what key on your keyboard maps to A, B, X or Y.Don't let that stand in your way of enjoying a very entertaining game though.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												Pretty cool game, feels like the oldschool shooters but missed the final boss fight. I usualy play every game in normal diff and this game did not sweated me at all, so you may take it on hard diff. The maps are beautiful but linear at construction, so very easy to find your way even in heavy action. Authority and their mutants are too weak in the whole game, just one pop rocket do the work in most case... It's ridiculous that Gearheads are tougher then Authority.I armed myself to the teeth for the finish, but could run through with just only pop rockets with some wing sticks and EMPs. At first time I didn't even need a single shoot with that plasma cannon at all. Really disappointed me the short end game, so where is the boss of Authority? After all the impressive game time I've only got that weak finish. Waited for more action, to return from Capital Prime and win a war or sg, but credits just interrupted.I feel there were more potential in game, just like viper rockets. When should I use those? Never ever was in a situation to get down a vehicle on foot... Mind control bolts? See the enemy as his head blows into pieces is fun, but there is no real need to use it. Maybe on higher difficulties player has a need to economize the resources better, but if you have plenty of everything, that ruins the game and I even didn't cheat a single dollar to simple get everything I would need. By the way are there any cheats? You won't need them.Oh and finally the low-mid VGAs with extra lot vram makes sense now.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2015
												I wasn't going to get this game, but after some careful thought and watching many trailers and game play videos, I decided to go out and give it a shot. I do not regret it one bit. This game is amazing. The graphics, sound, setting, ai, animations, mechanics, everything looks, and feels so good. Any fan of post-apocalyptic games needs to give this game a try. Any fan of shooters will not be disappointed, the enemies are always behaving in different ways, allowing you to utilise your entire arsenal in many different ways. The driving is a welcome addition and I found it a very enjoyable way to get to your quests. I've heard a lot of bad things (from critics and gamers alike), mainly in regards to story, but with a solid set of mechanics and awesome location and graphics, a less than awesome story is fine with me (I've only played 3 hours, so I am unable to give my own comments on the story). This game is definitely worth the money and you will not regret your purchase!

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												Apparently the game was plagued by buggy video drivers and issues when it came out and so there's still a lot of dismissal of it online, but when I got this game it ran perfectly and looked great. Texture quality could be better when you get right up against things, but from normal viewing distances it looks fine for when it came out. The gameplay is pretty bog-standard FPS with minimal RPG elements, but FPS is iD's bread and butter so it very well done for what it is.If you're going into it looking for something like Fallout or Borderlands, you're going to be very unsatisfied - the only commonalities are the general setting concept. While the visuals may not be the best in the world but the atmosphere itself still really stood out and I did at times wish it was a deeper or more open game set in that world.Campaign was about 18 hours for me which is pretty good for an FPS in my book - certainly more than any of the Quake single-player campaigns. There is a vehicular DM mode and short coop campaign mode, but I didn't try any of the multiplayer. I wish the main campaign supported coop as I would have loved to play through it with a friend.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												First the good:  Rage looks great.   The graphics, animations, character designs, etc, are all fantastic.  It also plays great.  The gameplay isn't anytihng really new, with the standard fps weapon selection and enemy types.   However, good enemy AI combined with their unique tendency to bob and weave and climb around levels, combined with very solid game mechanics, keeps things fun enough.   Vehicular combat is also enjoyable; rally racing itself seems like it could be a fun PVP standalone, and I'd love to have a local multiplayer version.  Now for the bad:  Nothing in Rage feels like it matters.  While the world and the characters in it look and sound great, none of them do anything or have any particular characteristics to make you care about them one way or the other.  They are merely window dressing.  The storyline itself is a bare bones mash up of Half Life 2 and Fallout, with bland generic factions like the Resistance and the Authority.  There is no main antagonist.   Missions are repetitive, with side quests basically just sending you back to zones you've already cleared in story missions.   It's also far too easy to actually be engaging, and you'll never really experience any of the tension that the games great looking enemies could have inspired.    Also, the game was also clearly designed and optimized for console, and some of the UI elements are just awful on PC (for example, only being able to assign 4 useable items to quickslot keys, rather than just allowing the player to assign them to whatever keys they like).  The game doesn't intelligently determine when you're using a keyboard/mouse or a controller, so controller propmts will stay on the screen even when using a keyboard until you disable the controller in settings (something I don't like doing, because generally I  use a controller for the driving portions of the game, and a keyboard/mouse for shooting).  There are also notiiceable performance issues, with framerates occasionaly plummetting for no good reason, and textures bouncing back and forth between high and low quality versions (this is on a gtx 960, which should be more than adequate to run this game at full settings).   I'm kind of on the fence about whether to recommend this game or not; really I'd give it about a 60-70 at most, and there are certainly better games out there to play.    Since Steams system requires giving it either a yay or nay, I'll recommend it with a couple of strong caveats: If you're looking for an engaging story, avoid it.  If you want a game that's perfectly optimized for PC, avoid it.   If you are strictly looking for a pretty looking, decent FPS, by all means give it a shot.

												It looks very pretty from far away, has decent arcadey shooting with all the enemies being extremely well-animated  has and fun side-activities.It looks ugly up close, the guns act and sound all like toys with the enemies being bullet sponges, and the game forces you to do half-baked racing missions.RAGE then has two, lasting giant flaws. MASSIVE loading times for every zone transition you'll be making every twenty minutes, and an ending that comes VERY quickly and out of nowhere.It's not terrible, but it's not great. It's very run-of-the-mill, nothing special. Only worth purchasing at low sale price and if you're bored.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												I love this game, even though it looks terrible nowadays compared to some titles from 2011. My main complaint though? 60fps cap.This is the first game I fired up after getting a 144hz monitor, and it looks so incredibly stuttery it's almost unplayable compared to virtually every other game that supports an uncapped framerate. Why, id, why couldn't you uncap the framerate to make it future-proof? Anyone else playing on a 144hz monitor will know exactly what I mean by stuttery (it has nothing to do with spec, I'm playing on a GTX 980/4th Gen i5)Is it a good game? Yes. Can I play it in its current state? No. The juddering is too much to live with I'm afraid, not when 98% of all fps games haven't capped their framerates.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												This game gets a bad rap at times, and people want to compare it to the Borderlands games. It's a fun game and the only big similarities it shares with Borderlands is the sandy/dusty/craggy landscape and driving cars around. The driving is a fairly big part of the game, as you can race for money to upgrade your vehicle further and thus have better armor out on the "roads" when doing missiony stuff. The rest of the game is a first person shooter with a nice 90s-style like...dozen weapons or so, as I recall, at least with the DLC...which I would recommend getting a few hours into the game if you find yourself enjoying it so far.There's some crafting, a few little minor upgrades (increasing max health and weapon parts), and NPCs to get a small number of quests/missions from. The story is alright, though not very engrossing. The setting and gameplay are the big draws here. I will say now that the ending sucks. It's boring and weak. That is all. With that out of the way, though, I found myself liking this game quite a bit. If you find it cheap, you might pick it up if you're not hurting for cash.

												Моя оценка этой игры 8 из 10.Игра мне понравилась неплохой графикой,наличием разных мини-игр,и вооружением(для каждого оружия 4 типа патрон на ваш вкус буть-то скажем динамитные и электрострелы или же для любителей стелса просто стальные наконечники или стрелы контроля разума к примеру)геймплей в 18-20 часов если доп.задания выполнять в принципе не надоедает как и перестрелки с врагами  при этом можно использовать различные средства к примеру(машины мины,турели,роботы,бумеранги срубающие врагам бошки)и всё это можно сделать самому как и особые патроны и медикаменты но тем не менее сюжет довольно схож с  фалаутом 3( то же от  этих же создателей бифездэй)и концовка то ли отсылка на следующюю часть то ли просто создатели решили над ней не слишком  напрягаться. Ну в общем  я советую вам поиграть в эту игру если вам понравился фалаут3(или 1 и 2)  или вы просто любитель постапокала но если вы в целом ненавидите творчество бифесдэй то можете ненадеятся что этот проект обелит их в ваших глазах.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												From graphical issues (even on high-end machines) to awkward physics, RAGE dissapoints. I had bought this game a few years ago and was not able to play it until recently, due to an issue where certain processors caused the game to fail to run. Having finally been able to play it, I can tell you with full certainty that it is a waste of the ten dollars I paid for it (physical retail price). Textures due not load quickly, meaning that one shopkeeper looks like an oversized deformed baby prior to his stubble and facial features loading, which takes a few seconds of staring at him. Textures un-render as soon as you turn away, meaning the whole game is played while staring at a child's first attempt at a watercolor painting. The physics are laughable as well. You obtain vehicles early in the game, and while backing up (slowly, I might add) I bumped into a wall. My character was ejected from the seat, hurled into an overhanging roof, and slammed back down into the ground. Respawn. This game plays like the unwanted child of a three-way between Fallout, Borderlands, and Call of Duty. It is clunky, enemies are relatively unintelligent unless they posses the ability to one-shot or two-shot you with their weapon, in which case they have impeccable aiming. Fetch-quests are rampant, and you will be going back and forth between locations within five minutes of completing the tutorial. Less than two hours of playtime, and the game is being uninstalled from my computer. It takes up more space than it's worth.
